meanings.sent1: The coys played together in the park.
meanings.sent2: I saw a cute coy at the pet store.
meanings.sent3: The coys wagged their tails happily.
meanings.sent4: The little coys were a bundle of joy.
meanings.sent5: The coys cuddled up for a nap.

meanings.definition: To urge or incite to action.
meanings.sent1: She coys her friends to join her for a hike.
meanings.sent2: The coach coys the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: He coys his brother to try the new dessert.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker coys the audience to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The teacher coys the students to participate in the class discussion.

meanings.sent1: She coys when someone compliments her.
meanings.sent2: He coys around his crush, trying to impress her.
meanings.sent3: The cat coys around the new visitors in the house.
meanings.sent4: The child coys when meeting new people.
meanings.sent5: The actor coys on stage, adding charm to the performance.
